  • 法国主要城市发生骚乱的第三晚
  • 数百人被捕，数百名警察受伤
  • 法国总统可能提前离开布鲁塞尔峰会
  • 美国、英国当局敦促国民谨慎行事

周五，法国总统埃马纽埃尔·马克龙召集内阁召开两天内的第二次危机会议，此前，全国范围内发生了最具破坏性的骚乱之夜，以抗议警察枪杀一名青少年。

当局称，骚乱者在法国各地城镇与警察发生冲突，建筑物和车辆被纵火，商店被抢劫，导致数百名警察受伤，数百人被捕。

周四晚上，内政部长杰拉尔德·达尔马宁部署了 4 万名警察，以平息第三晚的骚乱，他在推特上表示，警方逮捕了 667 人。

马赛、里昂、波城、图卢兹和里尔以及巴黎部分地区发生了暴力事件，其中包括南泰尔的工人阶级郊区，周二，17 岁的阿尔及利亚和摩洛哥血统的纳赫尔·M (Nahel M.) 在该地区被枪杀。一个交通站点。

当局称，全国范围内有 249 名警察受伤。

迄今为止，马克龙已排除宣布进入紧急状态的可能性，他原定于格林尼治标准时间 1100 点从布鲁塞尔举行的欧洲峰会提前飞回，与内阁会面。

总理伊丽莎白·博恩在推文中称暴力事件“无法容忍和不可原谅”，并重申她对“勇敢履行职责”的警察和消防员的支持。

一些西方国家政府早些时候警告其在法国的公民要谨慎行事。

美国大使馆周四在推文中表示，美国人“应避免大规模集会和警察活动频繁的地区”，而英国当局则敦促英国人监控媒体，避免抗议并在旅行时检查建议。

社交媒体上的视频显示全国各地的城市景观都在燃烧。东部城市里昂的一辆有轨电车被点燃，巴黎北部奥贝维利埃的一个车站有 12 辆公交车被毁。

交通部长克莱门特·博恩 (Clement Beaune) 告诉 RMC 电台，他不排除周五早些时候关闭首都公共交通网络的可能性。

南泰尔闪点

在该市郊区的南泰尔，抗议者在早些时候举行和平守夜活动以悼念死去的男孩后，焚烧汽车，封锁街道并向警察投掷弹丸。

巴黎警方称，在巴黎市中心的 Chatelet Les Halles 购物中心，一家耐克鞋店被闯入，邻近的里沃利路 (Rue de Rivoli) 购物街的商店橱窗被砸碎，数人被捕。

一位消息人士告诉路透社，全国各地的几家赌场超市遭到抢劫。

巴黎警方表示，他们已在市内及周边地区逮捕了 307 人，并有 9 名警察和消防员受伤。

纳赫尔·M.的死引发了长期以来对警察暴力和执法机构内部、权利团体以及法国主要城市周围低收入、种族混杂郊区的系统性种族主义的抱怨。

检察官称这名警察承认向这名少年开枪致命，周四他因故意杀人罪接受正式调查，相当于在盎格鲁-撒克逊司法管辖区受到指控。他目前被预防性拘留。

他的律师洛朗-弗兰克·利纳德 (Laurent-Franck Lienard) 表示，他的当事人原本瞄准了司机的腿，但被撞到，导致他朝自己的胸部开枪。 “显然（警官）不想杀死司机，”利纳德在 BFM 电视台上说道，

一夜之间，在法国南部，警察发射了催泪瓦斯手榴弹，马赛的旅游热点老港因年轻人与警察发生冲突而被疏散。当地警方表示，他们已逮捕 56 人，并有 38 名警察受伤。

在法国北部的鲁贝，一场大火烧毁了TESSI公司的办公室，多辆汽车被点燃。

这次骚乱让人回想起2005年的骚乱，那场骚乱使法国震动了三周，迫使时任总统雅克·希拉克宣布进入紧急状态。

这波暴力浪潮在巴黎郊区克利希苏布瓦爆发，并在两名年轻人躲避警察时在变电站触电身亡后蔓延至全国。

多米尼克·维达隆 (Dominique Vidalon)、苏迪普·卡尔-古普塔 (Sudip Kar-Gupta)、让-斯蒂芬·布罗斯 (Jean-Stephane Brosse)、伯努瓦·范·奥弗斯特拉滕 (Benoit Van Overstraeten)、帕斯卡·罗西尼奥尔 (Pascal Rossignol)、伊丽莎白·皮诺 (Elizabeth Pineau)、马克·勒拉斯 (Marc Leras) 报道；约翰·斯通斯特里特编辑; Fri, 30 Jun 2023 09:55:55 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/frances-macron-hold-new-crisis-meeting-after-third-night-riots-2023-06-30/ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/frances-macron-hold-new-crisis-meeting-after-third-night-riots-2023-06-30/Dominique Vidalon法国安全/拍摄（更新 4、PIX、电视） Climate nears point of no return as land, sea temperatures break records -expertsSummary:
  • 全球气温记录被打破
  • 海水温度也创历史新高
  • 气候谈判未能应对极端天气紧急情况
  • 美国气候特使克里预计七月抵达北京

气候专家表示，将全球变暖长期控制在 1.5 摄氏度（2.7 华氏度）以内的目​​标正在变得遥不可及，尽管陆地和海洋的高温持续了数月，但各国未能制定更雄心勃勃的目标。

欧盟资助的哥白尼气候变化服务中心 (C3S) 表示，当特使们于 6 月初齐聚波恩，为今年 11 月份的年度气候谈判做准备时，全球平均地表气温连续几天比工业化前水平高出 1.5 摄氏度以上。 。

尽管此前平均气温曾一度突破1.5摄氏度大关，但在6月1日开始的北半球夏季，这是第一次。海水温度也打破了4月和5月的记录。

“我们已经没有时间了，因为改变需要时间，”澳大利亚新南威尔士大学气候学家莎拉·珀金斯-柯克帕特里克说。

当两个最大温室气体排放国的气候特使准备下个月会面时，中国首都北京的气温打破了六月份的记录，极端热浪袭击了美国。

本月北美部分地区的气温比季节平均值高出约 10 摄氏度， 森林火灾产生的烟雾笼罩着加拿大和美国东海岸，造成危险的雾霾，碳排放量估计达到创纪录的 1.6 亿吨。

印度是气候最脆弱的地区之一，据报道，由于持续高温，死亡人数激增， 西班牙、伊朗和越南也出现了极端高温，人们担心去年致命的夏季可能会成为常态。

世界各国于 2015 年在巴黎同意努力将长期平均气温上升控制在 1.5 摄氏度以内，但现在有 66% 的可能性从现在到 2027 年至少一整年年平均气温将超过 1.5 摄氏度的门槛。气象组织预测5月。

“四重打击”

陆地温度升高，海洋温度升高，厄尔尼诺现象和其他因素加剧了变暖。

3 月下旬，全球平均海面温度达到 21 摄氏度，并在 4 月和 5 月期间保持在全年最高水平。澳大利亚气象机构警告称，到 10 月份，太平洋和印度洋的海水温度可能会比正常水平高出 3 摄氏度。

利兹大学气候物理学教授皮尔斯·福斯特表示，全球变暖是主要因素，但厄尔尼诺现象、撒哈拉海洋沙尘减少以及低硫航运燃料的使用也是罪魁祸首。

“总而言之，海洋正在遭受四重打击，”他说。 “这是未来事情的征兆。”

数以千计的死鱼被冲上德克萨斯州的海滩，高温引发的藻华也被认为是导致加利福尼亚州海狮和海豚死亡的原因。

佐治亚理工学院的气候学家安娜丽萨·布拉科表示，海洋变暖也可能意味着风雨减少，从而形成恶性循环，导致更加炎热。

她说，虽然今年的高海水温度是由各种情况的“完美结合”造成的，但对生态的影响可能会持续下去。

“海洋的反应将会非常缓慢，因为它会缓慢地积累（热量），但也会保持很长时间。”

通往迪拜之路

气候专家表示，极端天气的范围和频率正在增加，今年世界各地还出现了严重的干旱，非洲还出现了罕见的致命气旋。

然而，世界自然基金会警告称，本月在波恩举行的气候谈判期间“缺乏动力，令人担忧”，在 11 月于迪拜举行的 COP28 气候谈判之前，在化石燃料和金融等关键问题上几乎没有取得任何进展。

绿色和平组织驻北京高级气候顾问李硕表示：“这与波恩大楼外发生的事情完全脱节——我对此感到非常失望。”

“我们真的到了关键时刻……我希望纯粹的现实能够帮助我们改变人们的举动并改变政治。”

美国和中国之间的谈判可能会在下周恢复，美国气候特使约翰·克里将访问北京，但很少有人预计这会为气候谈判增添动力。

“这更像是一次建立信任的活动，”李说。 “我认为任何一方都无法迫使对方说出比他们愿意做的更多的事情——政治不允许这样做。”

国际货币基金组织和巴基斯坦达成了一项工作人员级协议，根据备用安排（SBA）提供 30 亿美元的救助资金。

该交易是根据 SBA 进行的，而不是巴基斯坦于 2019 年加入的延期基金贷款 (EFF) 计划，该计划将于周五到期。国际货币基金组织表示，SBA“建立在”EFF 的努力之上。

国际货币基金组织董事会将于七月中旬举行会议，批准工作人员级别协议。

以下是有关该协议的一些关键事实：

具有挑战性的改革

- 国际货币基金组织特别提到了巴基斯坦的电力部门，呼吁“及时”调整电价基准，以确保收回成本。这意味着尽管选举年的通胀率已经创历史新高，但消费者的价格仍将上涨。

- 面对外汇储备快速耗尽的情况，巴基斯坦央行应撤销为控制外部支付而实施的进口限制，但这些限制已经抑制了经济增长。储备金为 35 亿美元，勉强够支付一个月的受控进口量。

- 尽管卢比最近几周贬值至历史新低，但该国仍被要求完全致力于由市场决定的汇率，取消管制并消除不同市场的多种汇率做法。

- 央行还被要求保持“积极主动”降低通胀。该银行在本月预定的会议上暂停了加息进程。几天后，应国际货币基金组织的要求，它实施了非周期加息100个基点，将政策利率提高至22%。

- 国有企业的亏损给政府财政造成了巨大的缺口，因此需要加强治理。政府仅从停滞的私有化进程中获得约 150 亿巴基斯坦卢比（5,242 万美元）的收入预算。

更多资金

- 尽管国际货币基金组织的救助规模超出预期，但协议强调巴基斯坦将必须继续动员多边和双边金融支持。

- 沙特阿拉伯和阿拉伯联合酋长国已承诺总共提供 30 亿美元，随着国际货币基金组织协议的落实，预计将提供 30 亿美元。巴基斯坦最大债权国中国的债务展期也将是关键。

- 确保落实并建立今年早些时候在国际捐助者会议上作出的承诺的支出框架将是关键。超过 90 亿美元的气候相关承诺将帮助巴基斯坦在 2022 年从毁灭性洪水中恢复过来。

- 巴基斯坦需要220亿美元来为其外部支付义务提供资金，包括2024财年的国际偿债，该财年从7月1日星期六开始，到2024年6月30日结束。

坚持到底

- 国际货币基金组织强调，重要的是按计划执行修订后的年度预算，当局顶住未来一段时间内预算外支出或免税的压力。

- 协议指出，鉴于困难的挑战，全面、及时地实施该计划对于其成功至关重要。

- 该基金组织呼吁巴基斯坦“坚定地实施政策”和“财政纪律”，以克服当前的挑战，包括创纪录的高通胀、巨额财政赤字和建立低储备。

（1 美元 = 286.1500 巴基斯坦卢比）

一名高级国防官员周五表示，乌克兰军队正在向各个方向推进，对占领的俄罗斯军队进行反攻。

自本月反攻开始以来，乌克兰表示已重新控制了东南部村庄群，尽管俄罗斯仍控制着东部、南部和东南部的大片领土。

国防部副部长汉娜·马利亚尔对乌克兰电视台表示：“如果我们谈论整个前线，无论是东部还是南部，我们已经掌握了战略主动权，并且正在向各个方向推进。”

路透社无法核实战场情况。俄罗斯于 2022 年 2 月开始全面入侵，尚未承认乌克兰的成果，并表示乌克兰军队正在遭受重大伤亡。

马利亚尔表示，乌克兰军队正“自信地”在遭到破坏的东部城市巴赫穆特周围的侧翼移动，该城市由俄罗斯军队控制，主要战斗正在该城市周围进行。

她说，在南部，基辅部队的行动取得了不同程度的成功，主要是平整前线。

“在南部，我们的移动取得了不同程度的成功，有时超过一公里，有时不到一公里，有时长达两公里，”她说。

她指出，反攻的有效性应该通过“许多不同的军事任务”来评估，而不仅仅是通过进展和定居点的解放来评估。

“因此，所有这些任务正在执行，只有军方才能正确、准确地评估这一情况，根据他们的评估，一切都按计划进行，”她说。

总统泽连斯基表示，反攻的进展速度比预期的要慢，但基辅不会被迫加快反攻速度。

乌克兰官员还表示，反攻的“重头戏”尚未开始，乌克兰尚未将其主要预备部队投入战斗。

Anna Pruchnicka 和基辅新闻编辑室报道，Timothy Heritage 编辑; Fri, 30 Jun 2023 09:04:00 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-says-its-forces-advance-all-directions-counteroffective-2023-06-30/ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-says-its-forces-advance-all-directions-counteroffective-2023-06-30/Reuters乌克兰危机/战斗 (PIX) Greece migrant tragedy: coastguard rope capsized boat, survivor accounts say

希腊附近一场可能导致数百名移民死亡的船难的幸存者讲述了北非的贩运者将他们塞进一艘破旧的拖网渔船上的情况。他们讲述了甲板上下的地狱般的情况，没有食物或水。

一些人还表示，悲剧的结局是希腊海岸警卫队的行为促成的。他们告诉司法当局，他们曾试图拖曳这艘超载的拖网渔船，但最终导致该船于 6 月 14 日凌晨倾覆。

根据路透社看到的证据，幸存者向调查悲剧原因的希腊司法官员提交了九份声明，其中六份讲述了灾难性的海岸警卫队拖曳企图。

一名叙利亚幸存者表示，他和阿德里安娜号上的其他移民在前往意大利的途中抛锚，尖叫着“停下来！”一艘希腊海岸警卫队船只将一根绳子绑在拖网渔船的船头并开始拉动它，同时加快速度。

他补充说，移民船左右倾斜，然后翻了个底朝天。

其他三名目击者表示，他们不知道是什么原因导致阿德里安娜号翻船。路透社没有公布提供这些叙述的九名幸存者的姓名，这些叙述尚未公开。

六名目击者的证词与希腊海岸警卫队和政府的公开声明相冲突，希腊海岸警卫队和政府均表示，并未试图拖曳该船，当海岸警卫队距离该船约 70 米时，该船发生翻覆。

负责监督海岸警卫队的航运部告诉路透社，它无法对检察官正在进行的保密调查的问题发表评论。法律禁止希腊检察官对现场调查发表评论。

6 月 17 日至 18 日，九名幸存者向对这场灾难进行初步调查的调查人员提交了他们的叙述。一群涉嫌贩运者于 6 月 15 日被捕，罪名包括过失杀人、偷运移民和造成海难，目前已被监禁，等待更全面的调查，最终可能进行审判。他们否认有不当行为。

另外两名幸存者也讲述了拖车事件，他们分别接受了路透社的采访，由于担心遭到希腊当局的报复，他们要求匿名。其中一位自称穆罕默德的人描述了阿德里安娜号翻船时的可怕时刻，他说那是在海岸警卫队开始拖船时发生的。

“他们很快就把我们拉了出来，船就翻了。船向右、向左、向右移动，然后就翻了。人们开始互相摔倒，”他说。 “人们互相压在一起，人们在尖叫，人们互相淹死。那是晚上，有海浪。太可怕了。”

6 月 15 日，海岸警卫队发言人在回应当地媒体援引一些幸存者称拖网渔船被拖走的报道时，公开否认海岸警卫队船只曾在阿德里安娜号上系过绳索。

一天后，海岸警卫队修改了说法：称其船只已在“阿德里安娜”号上系了一根绳子，以帮助其靠近并进行通信。海岸警卫队否认其随后试图拖曳这艘拖网渔船，并称其保持了距离。

希腊海岸警卫队退役海军上将尼科斯·斯帕诺斯告诉路透社，海岸警卫队的船只不太可能尝试拖曳受损的拖网渔船这样危险的动作。

“它（海岸警卫队）的目的是建立更好的联系来帮助船只并评估情况。这是我的理解。因为如果他们试图拖走它或其他任何东西，那就太危险了，这不会这是正确的做法。”

“没有帮助。”去意大利吧”

联合国难民机构表示，当“阿德里安娜”号在希腊搜救管辖范围内的国际水域皮洛斯西南 47 英里处倾覆并沉没时，船上载有 400 至 750 名移民，其中大部分来自叙利亚、埃及和巴基斯坦。

总共找到了 104 名幸存者，但救援人员表示，在地中海最深处之一的地方，无论是死是活，都不太可能找到其他人。

证据显示，海岸警卫队船只的日志也已提交给司法当局，详细记录了海岸警卫队船只接近阿德里安娜号时相隔两小时的两次事件。

6 月 13 日晚上 11 点 40 分，该船接近了发动机出现故障的拖网渔船，并在船上绑了一根绳子，使其靠近并与船上人员交谈以评估情况，如果他们需要帮助，日志说。

日志称，船上的人大喊“没有救命”和“意大利加油”，并解开了绳索，日志称阿德里亚娜号的引擎随后重新启动，并向西行驶。

随后凌晨1点40分，在“阿德里安娜”号停止移动后，海岸警卫队船只接到运营中心的指示返回拖网渔船检查其状况。

日志显示，海岸警卫队船只接近距离阿德里安娜号约 70 米处，听到大量喊叫声，不到七分钟，拖网渔船就倾覆了。

The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has reached a staff-level pact with Pakistan on a $3 billion stand-by arrangement, the lender said, a decision long awaited by the South Asian nation which is teetering on the brink of default .

The deal, subject to approval by the IMF board in July, came hours before the current agreement with the IMF expires later on Friday. Although essentially a bridge loan, it offers much respite to Pakistan, which is battling an acute balance of payments crisis and falling foreign exchange reserves.

The agreement will enable Pakistan to achieve economic stability, and put the country "on the path of sustainable economic growth, God willing," Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said.

Pakistan will receive formal documents on the deal later on Friday from the IMF, Finance Minister Ishaq Dar told Reuters, which he said he would "sign, seal and return by tonight."

He had said on Thursday the deal was expected any time soon.

Pakistan's sovereign dollar bonds were trading higher after the announcement, with the 2024 issue enjoying the biggest gains, up more than 8 cents at just above 70 cents in the dollar, according to Tradeweb data.

The gains were most pronounced in shorter-dated bonds, reflecting lingering scepticism over the longer-term fiscal outlook for the country.

The country's domestic stock and currency markets were closed on Friday due to Eid festival holidays.

With sky-high inflation and foreign exchange reserves barely enough to cover one month of controlled imports, analysts say Pakistan's economic crisis could have spiralled into a debt default in the absence of an IMF deal.

The $3 billion funding, spread over nine months, is higher than expected. The country was awaiting the release of the remaining $2.5 billion from a $6.5 billion bailout package agreed in 2019, which expires on Friday.

The IMF funding will also unlock other bilateral and multilateral external financing and debt rollovers, particularly from friendly countries like Saudi Arabia and the UAE, which have already pledged around $3 billion.

"This will support near-term policy efforts and replenish gross reserves, with the aim of bringing them to more comfortable levels," the IMF said.

POWER PRICE HIKES

The new stand-by arrangement builds on the 2019 programme, IMF official Nathan Porter said on Thursday, adding that Pakistan's economy had faced several challenges in recent times, including devastating floods last year and commodity price hikes following the war in Ukraine.

"Despite the authorities' efforts to reduce imports and the trade deficit, reserves have declined to very low levels. Liquidity conditions in the power sector also remain acute," Porter said in a statement.

"Given these challenges, the new arrangement would provide a policy anchor and a framework for financial support from multilateral and bilateral partners in the period ahead."

Porter also pointed out the power sector's buildup of arrears and frequent power outages.

Reforms in the energy sector, which has accumulated nearly 3.6 trillion Pakistani rupees ($12.58 billion) in debt, has been a cornerstone of the discussions with the IMF.

The IMF would want steadfast policy implementation by Pakistan to overcome challenges, "particularly in the energy sector," the statement said.

"The authorities' programme also includes ongoing efforts to strengthen the viability of the energy sector (including through a timely FY24 annual rebasing)," the lender said, which means a rise in electricity tariffs in the fiscal year.

Government sources told Reuters that the hike will come ahead of the IMF board review of the bailout in mid-July.

PAINFUL REFORMS

Islamabad has taken a slew of policy measures since an IMF team arrived in Pakistan earlier this year, including a revised 2023-24 budget last week to meet the lender's demands.

Other adjustments demanded by the IMF before clinching the deal included reversing subsidies in power and export sectors, hikes in energy and fuel prices, jacking up the key policy rate to 22%, a market-based currency exchange rate and arranging for external financing.

It also got Pakistan to raise over 385 billion rupee ($1.34 billion) in new taxation through a supplementary budget for the 2022-23 fiscal year and the revised budget for 2023-24.

Going forward, the IMF said, the central bank should remain pro-active to reduce inflation and maintain a foreign exchange framework.

The painful adjustments have already fuelled all time high inflation of 38% year-on-year in May.

"The FY24 budget advances a primary surplus of around 0.4 percent of GDP by taking some steps to broaden the tax base and increase tax collection from under-taxed sectors," Porter said, adding it also ensured space to strengthen support for the vulnerable through a cash handout programme.

He said it will be important that the budget is executed as planned, and authorities resist pressures for unbudgeted spending or tax exemptions in the period ahead.

"This new programme is far better than our expectations," said Mohammed Sohail of Topline Securities in Karachi, adding there were a lot of uncertainties on what would happen after a new government comes to power later in the year.

"This funding of 3 billion dollars and for 9 months will definitely help restore some investor confidence," he said.

Russia is gradually reducing the number of personnel at the occupied Zaporizhzhia nuclear power station in southern Ukraine, Ukraine's military intelligence agency said on Friday.

It did not say why some people had left and Reuters could not independently verify the information. Russia, which has occupied the plant since March 2022, did not immediately comment on the assertion.

Kyiv accused Russia this month of planning a "terrorist" attack at the nuclear plant involving the release of radiation. Moscow denied the accusation.

"According to the latest data, the occupation contingent is gradually leaving the territory of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant," Main Directorate of Intelligence at the Ministry of Defence (GUR) said on the Telegram messaging app.

GUR said that among the first to leave the nuclear power station were three employees of Russian state nuclear firm Rosatom who had been "in charge of the Russians' activities".

It said Ukrainian employees who have signed a contract with Rosatom had also been advised to depart.

Employees should leave by July 5, it said, and preferably head for the Crimea peninsula, which Russia seized from Ukraine in 2014.

GUR said the number of military patrols was also gradually decreasing on the plant's vast territory and in the nearby city of Enerhodar, and personnel remaining at the plant had been told to blame Ukraine "in case of any emergency situations".

Ukraine conducted nuclear disaster response drills on Thursday in the vicinity of the plant.

Kyiv and Moscow have accused each other of shelling the vast complex at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power station, Europe's largest.

Ukraine, then part of the Soviet Union, suffered the world's worst nuclear accident in 1986 at the Chornobyl nuclear power plant.

Britain's economy grew 0.1% in the first quarter of this year, unrevised from an initial estimate published last month, figures from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) showed on Friday.

However, the ONS said Britain's gross domestic product (GDP) in the first quarter of this year was 0.5% smaller than it was before in the final quarter of 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic, also in line with a previous estimate.

"The final Q1 2023 GDP data confirms that the economy steered clear of a recession at the start of 2023. But with around 60% of the drag from higher interest rates yet to be felt, we still think the economy will tip into one in the second half of this year," Ashley Webb, UK economist at consultancy Capital Economics, said.

Britain's economic recovery since the COVID-19 pandemic has been much slower than almost every other big advanced economy, though Germany has struggled too and its economy in the first quarter was 0.5% smaller than before the pandemic.

British households have been put under pressure by a surge in inflation, which hit a 41-year high last year after Russia's invasion of Ukraine sent natural gas prices soaring, and has been slow to fall since.

Friday's figures showed that households' real disposable income was 0.8% smaller than the previous quarter, reflecting higher costs for electricity, gas and food.

There were also signs that people were saving less in response to the increased cost of living, as the savings ratio fell to 8.7% in the first quarter from 9.4% in the quarter before, its lowest level since the second quarter of 2022 though well above its pre-pandemic average.

Britain's current account deficit totalled 10.8 billion pounds in the first quarter, above economists' forecast of 8.5 billion pounds in a Reuters poll and equivalent to 1.7% of GDP.

Stripping out volatile trade in precious metals, the ONS's preferred measure, the underlying current account deficit narrowed to 2.6% of GDP from 3.3% of GDP in the final quarter of 2022.

Hungary rejects the European Commission's plans to grant more money to Ukraine and is not willing to contribute additional money to finance the EU's increased debt service costs, Prime Minister Viktor Orban told state radio on Friday.

Orban, speaking on the sidelines of the EU summit in Brussels, said it was a "ridiculous" request from the Commission that Hungary should contribute more money, when Budapest - along with Poland - has not received funds from the EU's Recovery Fund amid a rule of law dispute.

The European Union will provide Ukraine with 50 billion euros ($54.30 billion) in aid for 2024-27 , the bloc's president said on June 20. This comes after a review of the EU's 2021-27 shared budget, which has been depleted by the COVID-19 pandemic, the war in Ukraine and an energy crisis. High inflation and interest rates have also doubled debt-servicing costs.

"One thing is clear, we Hungarians ... will not give more money to Ukraine until they say where the previous around 70 billion euros worth of funds had gone," Orban said.

"And we find it utterly ridiculous and absurd, that we should contribute more money to finance debt service costs of a loan, from which we have still not received the funds we are entitled to get."

Hungary and Poland are the only EU members lagging behind in getting the recovery funds, which the Commission has blocked over accusations that the two countries' nationalist governments damage democracy and the rule of law.

Orban said there was almost no chance that European Union member states would approve these financial plans and a "long fight" would start.

On Thursday, EU leaders declared they would make long-term commitments to bolster Ukraine's security as Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy urged them to start work on a new round of sanctions against Russia.
